message: We are using omniauth to deal with Twitter and Facebook OAuth. The routes are /auth/facebook and /auth/twitter on our site. However, we also have /:channel/:video_id as one of our routes and it catches the /auth/facebook as params[:channel]=> 'auth' and params[:video_id]=>'facebook'. Omniauth seems to want the routes to fall thru in order to have the facebook log in page to show up.
Only /auth/facebook fails? Also you might wanna check the order of your routes, as they're match by creation order
You can also test routes in the console
puts your route below the ones of omniauth
Essentially, the route /:channel/:video_id will catch all routes formatted like /a/b, so mke sure that route is below your Twitter and Facebook routes in your routes.rb file.
